sentences.sContent: Slater remained at the house, acting as its caretaker when the family was not in residence.
sentences.sCn: 这家人不在的时候，斯莱特留在这幢房子里看家。

sentences.sContent: The military intends to hand over power to a caretaker government and hold elections within six months.
sentences.sCn: 军方打算将权力移交给临时政府，并在6个月内进行选举。

remMethod.val: 来自词组take care (of) (照料， 处理)

trans.tranOther: someone who looks after a house or land while the person who owns it is not there
A caretaker government or leader is in charge temporarily until a new government or leader is appointed
